sentences.sContent: It is unlikely that the marine industry will fare any better in September.
sentences.sCn: 海运业不大可能在9月份有所好转。

phrases.pCn: 公共汽车票钱；公车票；公车费率
飞机票价；航空费用；航空票价

remMethod.val: 若愿与我同行， 我不在乎(care)船费(fare)

trans.tranOther: If you say that someone or something fares well or badly, you are referring to the degree of success they achieve in a particular situation or activity
the price you pay to travel somewhere by bus, train, plane etc
